revised_title: Discovery of Sorbic Acid and Its Properties from Mountain Ash Berries
tldr: A. W. Hofmann and Dr. George Merck discovered a new volatile organic acid, sorbic acid, from the berries of the mountain ash. They found that it has remarkable properties and can be converted into a crystalline acid. The discovery of sorbic acid led to the study of isomerism and the establishment of a new series of organic acids.
